data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you always face forward or face backward, you are always facing forward. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn right and turn around. Both are the same action. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
We return to starting point after doing four steps. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
It takes 7 steps to return to the starting point whereas 7 steps are one step away from the starting point. One step of taking 7 steps is one step away. So, the answer is Yes.

If you make the correct turning, you return to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

Right turns left and left turns right. If you follow the instructions: Turn out of the turn and turn left 7 times. If you follow the instructions: turn around and turn around 7 times. Take 2 steps after turning around. The first step is 6. The second step is 8. The third step is 6. So, the answer is Yes.

If you face forward in the instructions, you start towards the left side or the right side of the direction you're facing. So, the answer is Yes.

You would only need 3 steps if you were turning around. You would need 2 steps to turn around. Your instructions said to take 5 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Walking backward takes one step backward. Going forward takes three steps forward. So, the answer is No.

Just because you are facing forward, it doesn’t mean you are always facing forward. So, the answer is no.

Any step made from any direction becomes the starting point. Just like turning left will always result in ending up at a destination. So, the answer is yes.

A person facing forward, begins facing to the left. Taking 3 steps forward, begins towards the right. So, the answer is Yes.

Take 3 steps left. Redirect 2 ways 2 steps. Take 3 steps right.

To return to the starting point from where you landed, you turn around, take 1 step, then takes a different direction, and then takes two steps to you starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

You cannot step backwards to get to the starting point. Turn right and take one step from your current side and then take 1 step and take 5 steps. So, the answer is No.

The starting point is located either at 3 steps or at 5 steps. The starting point is in a straight line 5 steps to the right and then 6 steps to the left. It does not run in a circle and the starting point is in a turn, so you only need to take 7 steps to get there. So, the answer is no.

The instructions repeat for a total of 7 steps left + 2 steps right + 5 steps backward. Therefore, the answer is no.

Turn right, take 5 steps, then turn around. If you take the same steps twice, you have twice the number of steps to turn around than if you took the same steps twice. So, the answer is No.

All the instructions work only if you always face forward. There is no time for things to get lost or the timing of things to get right. The reverse direction from direction given is not the direction in which you started. So, the answer is No.

Turning around after taking 1 step will take you back to take 7 steps. Turning around around before taking another step will return you to the starting point. So, the answer is no.

To take 9 steps forward, every time one steps backward, one must begin again. The starting point is always face forward. So, the answer is Yes.

In one sequence you take 8 steps left. In another sequence, you take 1 step backward, so when you try to return to the starting point you are backwards from the starting point. So, the answer is no.

You should always take any given order that is given, like starting with 7 steps left, right on the right side of the street, take 8 steps on the left side of the street, do 4 steps left, end on the left side of the street, take 10 feet back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

Take right 8 steps, then take 8 steps left. Take left 5 steps, then take 5 steps left. Take right 4 steps, then take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps forward, and take 5 steps right. So, the answer is Yes.

Continuing the same position, you will now be facing left. In order to complete the same line of progression, we will now move forward from right to left. As is usual for directions, you will always reverse direction back to the starting point. Thus, the answer is Yes.
